page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES (1)
page.content: {HISTORY}The housing estate of{SPEKE}is bordered on one side by the centuries old tiny{Anglo-Saxon}village of{HALE, which lies on the northern bank of the River Mersey in the County of Cheshire and is about ten miles from the centre of Liverpool. It is famous for its daffodil fields and is one of the best wheat growing areas in the north-west, is well known for the smallholders who grow dahlias, chrysanthemums, and other flowers in gardens at the back of tiny thatched white-washed cottages. The famous{Childe of Hale}lived not far from the Church and early 18th century Manor House,{HALE HALL}which was the home of the Ireland and Blackburne Families, and now lies in ruin covered in a thick growth of ivy, trees and briars.
